caller_intent: Henry is seeking resolution for a missing home insurance bill and discussing payment preferences (check vs. AutoPay) after experiencing issues with online payment systems in the past.
resolution_steps: Corbin confirms the home insurance bill was sent to the correct address (7703 Antoinette Drive, Richmond, VA 23227) and notes a waived fee of $19.
Discusses AutoPay options (quarterly, semi-annually, annually) but acknowledges Henry's preference for sending checks.
Agrees to email Henry the relevant documents and follow up the next day to ensure receipt and finalize payment arrangements.
knowledge_required: Insurance billing processes (e.g., waived fees, missing bills)
Handling customer preferences for payment methods (online vs. check)
systems_referenced: Insurance carrier portals (implied through bill details and waived fees)
summary: Henry reports a missing home insurance bill and expresses a preference for check payments due to past issues with online systems. Corbin verifies the bill details, explains AutoPay options, and arranges to email documents for review. The call concludes with a commitment to follow up the next day to resolve the payment issue.
